Rich et al-
	Not sure what it means but my kanji dictionary says this is read 
"HENKA-gata", I think strange or oddball flower shape is as close as we 
may get. Henka alone means transformation, in Buddhism it is used when 
the Buddha changes form to appear as a man, but don't think this 
applies here...
-t
